page.title: 07GAIRLOCH BLACKSMITH
page.content: {Gairloch blacksmith}was originally a church until the end of world war II, then it was a joiners and presently a smithy. Mr Findlater runs the blacksmith helped by his father and three other workers.Mainly his work involves making gates and fences using many different designs,repair work and he occassionally shoes horses. The blacksmith's is a very noisy place to work because of the machinery they use and the constant clanging of hammers, moulding metal into shape. The building still retains the stain- glass windows although the belfry has been removed and re-erected in the corner of the garden.Also,the roof has been renovated. Jobs can vary from contract work for firms to simple tasks such as putting a handle on a coal shovel.
